title: Little Jewel - Stylized Bold
content:
I know the L and W are stylized, but the rest looks so familiar to me that I keep thinking I should know it. Can someone help. I just need a starting point on this re-creation. (I used to be much better at this)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161041im_/http:/typophile.com/files/identify_3651.jpg)

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161041/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [identify.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161041/http:/typophile.com/files/identify_7.jpg) | 77.04 KB |
author: mpboulder

comments.content:
It probably reminds you of **[Bauer Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161041/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=URW%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Bauer%20Bodoni%20T%20-%20Bold%20Italic&fid=25efb22ca05308ebec93ea920551f378&fsize=60&text=The%20Little%20Jewel&wrap=2)**  
but it's finally closer to **[Annlie Extra Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161041/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Elsner%2BFlake%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Annlie%20EF%20Extra%20Bold%20Italic%20-%20Regular&fid=cfe8bb1405fc3a2bb3ffaed31961034f&fsize=60&text=The%20Little%20Jewel&wrap=2)**  
while **[Normande Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161041/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Bitstream%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Normande%20It%20BT%20-%20Italic&fid=dc8aed68e17f34dedeab49f6190d784b&fsize=60&text=The%20Little%20Jewel&wrap=2)** by Bitstream is also somewhat close in style.
